experience.description: Full-stack development and infrastructure management for enterprise food service operations serving thousands of users daily.
achievements: Architected and maintained scalable GCP infrastructure using Terraform for enterprise food service operations
Implemented comprehensive CI/CD pipelines using GitLab CI, Jenkins, and Spinnaker for automated deployment
Integrated monitoring and observability solutions including Elasticsearch, Kibana, and performance monitoring
Managed containerized workloads on GCP Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and GCP App Engine for high availability
Optimized cloud infrastructure costs while maintaining 99.9%+ uptime for mission-critical systems
Developed modern frontend applications using Angular 18+, NgRx state management, and TypeScript
Built robust backend services using Java 21, Spring Boot, with Docker containerization
Integrated multiple data storage solutions including GCP Cloud Datastore, Redis caching, and Nginx load balancing

experience.description: Designed and implemented secure AWS environments for mission-critical telecommunications applications.
achievements: Designed, implemented, and secured AWS environments for multiple mission-critical telecommunications applications
Developed Jenkins automation pipelines for code analysis and artifact deployment to production servers
Achieved 30%+ cost optimization on AWS infrastructure through rightsizing and resource management
Mentored development teams on cloud best practices across multiple programming languages
Created Infrastructure as Code using Ansible playbooks and CloudFormation templates

experience.description: Designed and implemented scalable technical solutions for telecommunications applications including 5G coverage mapping.
achievements: Designed and implemented RESTful APIs and database schemas using Java and Python
Translated complex business requirements into scalable technical solutions
Developed geospatial data processing applications for Verizon's 5G Coverage Map
Collaborated with product teams to ensure technical solutions aligned with business objectives

experience.description: Technical lead for backend Java systems supporting Verizon's 5G Home product customer qualification.
achievements: Served as technical lead and gatekeeper for multiple backend Java repositories
Coordinated API integrations across multiple development teams for unified product delivery
Architected backend systems for Verizon's 5G Home product customer qualification
Optimized existing Java applications for improved performance and maintainability
Provided technical guidance and code review for development team members

projects.name: AWS Infrastructure Registry
projects.description: A curated collection of reusable AWS Infrastructure as Code (IaC) templates and automation tools. This repository serves as a reference library for common AWS infrastructure components, enterprise baselines, and architectural patterns, utilizing CloudFormation, AWS CDK (TypeScript), and Go-based Lambda functions.

projects.name: Wheeler Universe Portfolio
projects.description: Interactive solar system portfolio built with Vue.js and TypeScript

projects.name: Wheeler Universe Blog
projects.description: A modern blog aggregation website built with Vue 3, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. This application aggregates blog posts from multiple platforms under the Wheeler Universe brand.

projects.name: Resume Site from JSON
projects.description: Builds a resume website dynamically based on JSON data that can be modified at run-time and shared with a custom URL.

projects.name: Wheeler Recommends Site
projects.description: This repository contains the code for a serverless PHP movie recommendation engine. It demonstrates unconventional techniques for bold developers leveraging AWS Serverless technologies to host dynamic websites. The project prioritizes cost-efficiency, rapid scalability, and ease of maintenance.

projects.name: Wheeler Recommends Scraper
projects.description: This repository contains a serverless web scraper designed to collect data from wheelerrecommends.com. It leverages Python, Beautiful Soup, and Selenium to scrape website content and stores the data in S3 for further analysis using AWS Glue and Athena.

projects.name: Multicloud Serverless Resume
projects.description: A comprehensive three-tier serverless resume application deployed across AWS, Azure, and GCP. This project showcases multicloud architecture using an Angular frontend, a Java Spring Boot backend, Infrastructure as Code with Terraform, and a full CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions.

projects.name: Serverless Resume on GCP
projects.description: A complete serverless resume application on GCP, featuring a Vue.js frontend, a Flask API backend, and Terraform for IaC. Created for the A Cloud Guru Community Challenge.

projects.name: AWS App Performance w/ ElastiCache
projects.description: Builds a resume website dynamically based on JSON data that can be modified at run-time and shared with a custom URL.

projects.name: The Azure Resume Challenge
projects.description: A serverless resume website built on Azure. The frontend is a static site hosted in Azure Blob Storage, with a visitor counter powered by an Azure Function and Azure Table Storage. The infrastructure is deployed and updated via a CI/CD pipeline.

projects.name: Azure CI/CD for a Global Web App
projects.description: A globally-performant Ruby on Rails application deployed on Microsoft Azure with a complete CI/CD pipeline using Azure DevOps, ARM Templates, and Azure Front Door for content delivery.

projects.name: Multicloud Serverless Image Processing Pipeline
projects.description: Builds a resume website dynamically based on JSON data that can be modified at run-time and shared with a custom URL.

projects.name: AWS ML Recommendation Engine
projects.description: A Netflix-style movie recommendation engine built with AWS SageMaker and served through a serverless PHP website using AWS Lambda and Bref.

projects.name: AWS COVID-19 ETL Pipeline
projects.description: A serverless, event-driven ETL pipeline for processing COVID-19 data from the New York Times and Johns Hopkins datasets using AWS services.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science Degree, Game Design and Development
highlights: Developed strong systems thinking and analytical skills through discrete mathematics, statistics, and complex system design courses
Gained extensive experience in iterative design methodologies, prototyping, and user experience optimization through game design projects
Built collaborative leadership abilities through team-based portfolio projects and cross-functional group coordination
Mastered technical problem-solving and programming fundamentals essential for software architecture and development
Learned to balance multiple constraints (technical, creative, and business) while delivering functional solutions under tight deadlines
Cultivated effective communication skills through professional writing, creative presentation, and stakeholder management coursework
Completed Harvard University's Introduction to Computer Science, strengthening algorithmic thinking and computational problem-solving
Mastered modern web development technologies through Microsoft's HTML, CSS, and JavaScript courses
Gained proficiency in C++ and R programming languages for systems development and data analysis applications
Developed statistical analysis and data science skills through University of Texas at Austin's comprehensive data analysis program
Enhanced project management capabilities with University of Adelaide's structured approach to planning and execution
Demonstrated commitment to continuous learning and self-directed professional development

blogPosts.title: Conquering the Multi-Cloud Resume Challenge: My Journey to a Serverless Showcase
blogPosts.description: I successfully built a comprehensive serverless resume application deployed across AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform for the Meta Resume Challenge, demonstrating multi-cloud proficiency, Infrastructure as Code, and CI/CD, and gaining insights into cross-cloud performance and cost.

blogPosts.title: From Dusty Requirements to Live Website: How Claude Code Built My Blog Aggregator in a Single Day
blogPosts.description: I transformed my lengthy requirements document into a live, production-ready blog aggregation website in a single day, all thanks to Claude Code and some careful prompt engineering.

blogPosts.title: How I Crushed My AWS Certification Renewals Back-to-Back (and Why It Was a Bad Idea)
blogPosts.description: I successfully renewed all 12 of my AWS certifications in just 22 days to align their dates, but I strongly advise against this intense approach due to the significant toll it took on my mental and physical well-being.

speakingEvents.title: Optimizing Your AWS Bill: Strategies for Reducing Costs and Maximizing ROI
speakingEvents.description: In this presentation, we will delve into the world of AWS cost savings and explore the various methods for reducing your AWS bill. From tagging strategies to leveraging reserved instances, we will discuss practical strategies for optimizing your AWS infrastructure and minimizing unnecessary expenses. We will also cover best practices and tooling for monitoring and managing your AWS usage and tips for identifying and eliminating unnecessary costs.

speakingEvents.title: A RedMonk Conversation with Developer Certification Enthusiast Justin Wheeler
speakingEvents.description: Discussed trends in cloud-native development and the evolving role of developers in the cloud era.

speakingEvents.title: AWS Serverless Remix: Unconventional Techniques for the Bold Developer
speakingEvents.description: Ever pushed the boundaries of a serverless service to its limit? Maybe you were squeezed by budget constraints, fueled by sheer stubborn determination, or just curious about what the heck it could do. Whatever your reason, this talk dives into the unorthodox approaches that emerged from these explorations. Basic knowledge of AWS, traditional serverless architecture, and any programming language is suggested. Key takeaways are an improved mindset when thinking of serverless applications and new found knowledge for technologies that are less commonly used.

speakingEvents.title: False External Perception of the Tech Industry
speakingEvents.description: As part of this panel, we discussed how the tech industry's "smartness" perception is a myth, emphasizing that diverse backgrounds and self-taught paths are valuable, and that successful entry and growth often hinge on candid storytelling, building relationships, and publicly sharing our learning journeys, despite facing inevitable challenges.

communityInvolvement.description: Contributed to the strategic direction and oversight of educational programs, fostering community growth and development.
Selected member of the AWS Community Builders program, focusing on Serverless and DevOps.
Helping organize and speak at local technology meetups and conferences.
Regular contributor writing about cloud technologies and development practices.
Ensured smooth operation of conference sessions, providing support to speakers and attendees for a positive event experience over several years.
Provided constructive feedback and industry insights to computer science students during mock interviews, aiding their professional development.
Participating in an inclusive community of developers supporting each other's growth.
